---
title: "Further Legends"
---

<div id="legends" class="section level1">
<h1>Legends</h1>
<p>Many of the previous characteristics are the same for both axes and legends. Legends can:</p>
<ul>
<li>Display multiple aesthetics from multiple layers</li>
<li>Appear in many different locations.</li>
<li>Can be sized and ordered differently.</li>
</ul>
<p>You can also choose what is placed in a legend. We use the <code>show.legend</code> command to do this.</p>
<pre class="r"><code>ggplot(df, aes(y, y)) +
    geom_point(size = 4, colour = &quot;grey20&quot;) +
    geom_point(aes(colour = z), size = 2)
ggplot(df, aes(y, y)) +
    geom_point(size = 4, colour = &quot;grey20&quot;, 
               show.legend = TRUE) +
    geom_point(aes(colour = z), size = 2)</code></pre>
<p>Sometimes we wish to have the legends display different things. For example if we use transparent colors in the plot we may want solid colors in the legend. The <code>alpha</code> command will make the colors more transparent. However we can override the legend colors and set the <code>alpha</code> differently:</p>
<pre class="r"><code>norm &lt;- data.frame(x = rnorm(1000), y = rnorm(1000))
norm$z &lt;- cut(norm$x, 3, labels = c(&quot;a&quot;, &quot;b&quot;, &quot;c&quot;))
ggplot(norm, aes(x, y)) +
    geom_point(aes(colour = z), alpha = 0.1)
ggplot(norm, aes(x, y)) +
    geom_point(aes(colour = z), alpha = 0.1) +
    guides(colour = guide_legend(override.aes = list(alpha = 1)))</code></pre>
<p>The graph below shows the graph on the left where we let R create the legend. Then the graph on the right shows our changes and overriding on the colors.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="672" /></p>
<div id="legend-layouts" class="section level2">
<h2>Legend Layouts</h2>
<p>We can choose the specific layout of the legend. For example we can place it at the top, bottom, right , left or not even have a legend at all.</p>
<pre class="r"><code>df &lt;- data.frame(x = 1:3, y = 1:3, z = c(&quot;a&quot;, &quot;b&quot;, &quot;c&quot;))
base &lt;- ggplot(df, aes(x, y)) +
    geom_point(aes(colour = z), size = 3) +
    xlab(NULL) +
    ylab(NULL)
base + theme(legend.position = &quot;right&quot;) # the default
base + theme(legend.position = &quot;bottom&quot;)
base + theme(legend.position = &quot;none&quot;)</code></pre>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="672" /></p>
</div>
